resources.string: "There is nothing to pick up in your locker at the moment."
"You currently didn’t share access to your parcel locker(s) with anyone."
"For further questions send an e-mail to:"
"Remove temporary access from %s for Delivery %s (created on: %s)"
"%s shared you access to delivery (size: %s, created: %s)"
"Thank you! Your request was submitted. We’ll notify you once your access has been granted."
"Tap on the Lock icon to open."
"Please take your package and close locker door."
"There is nothing to pick up in your locker at the moment."
"The locker is now open. Please place your package and close the door."
"Please enter your registered e-mail address so that we can send you a recovery PIN."
"Error while removing user access, please try again later!"
"Please select a locker you would like to use."
"You are invited to use ZWICKbox app."
"Error while deleting the key for user %s, please try again!"
"Error while saving user id %s please try again!"
"Password must be at least 6 characters long"
"Username must be at least 4 characters long"
"Please accept General Terms and Conditions and Privacy Statement."
"Failure while fetching pick at friend keys"
"Failure while canceling pick at friend key"
"User not found. Click OK if you want to share the app"
"Are you sure you want to deactivate this locker?"
"SPL can't be deactivated because of the active key."
"Are you sure you want to delete this key?"
"What would you like to do today?"
"You have to be in the proximity of the locker to cancel pick@home"
"Your PIN = last 4 digits of your tracking number."
"To be sure there was no mistake please repeat your PIN"
"Are you sure you want to sign out?"
"You can sign in again at any time."
"Seems that you are not near your locker. Get into proximity of locker %s to unlock it."

"Last updated: June 2019
ZWICK (referred to as \"we\", \"us\" or \"our\") is committed to safeguarding your privacy and ensuring that you trust ZWICK with your personal data. When you (referred to as \"Visitor\") interact with us with regards to requiring additional information about our services or subscribing to our newsletter, you may share personal data with us which allows identification of you as an individual (e.g. name, last name, e-mail address and company name). In this notice, we elaborate how we use that data and what are your rights while interacting with us on this website/app.
1. Introduction This Privacy Notice applies to the personal data that we collect about you for the purposes of providing you with our products and services we offer. By using our website/app, or by giving us your personal data, you accept the practices described in this Privacy Notice. If you do not agree to this Privacy Notice, please do not use our site or give us any personal data. ZWICK reserves the right to make changes to this Privacy Notice at any time. We encourage you to regularly review this Privacy Notice to make sure you are aware of any changes and how your personal data may be used.
2. Data collected by this website/app Personal Data which this we website/app collects include Usage Data, first and last name, e-mail information and company name. Name, e-mail and company name is freely provided by the Providing personal data is not mandatory on this website/app, and failure to provide it will not make it impossible for the website/app to provide its services. In case of Usage Data, we use cookies which are automatically collected while visiting the website/app.
2.1. Cookies Cookies are files with small amount of data that is commonly used an anonymous unique identifier. These are sent to your browser from the website/app that you visit and are stored on your computer's hard drive. Our website/app uses these \"cookies\" to collection information and to improve our Service. You have the option to either accept or refuse these cookies, and know when a cookie is being sent to your computer.
2.2. Children's personal data ZWICK does not knowingly solicit or collect personal data from children below the age of 13. If we discover that we have accidentally collected personal data from a child below 13, we will remove that child's personal data from its records as soon as reasonably possible. However, we may collect personal data about children below the age of 13 years of age from the parent or custodian directly and therefore with their explicit consent.
3. Your rights
3.1. Right to opt-out of newsletter communication You have the right to opt-out of receiving newsletters from ZWICK. You can do so directly from your e-mail by clicking \"unsubscribe\". If you didn't keep any of previous newsletters you can unsubscribe by sending an e-mail to support@zwick.it requesting to be removed from newsletter list.
3.2. Access and rectification You have a right to request access to your personal data. You may send us a request, at any time, in order to consult us to learn about your Personal Data contents and origin, to verify data accuracy or to ask for data to be supplemented, cancelled, updated or corrected. Requests should be send to us at the contact information set out above, and will be answered in no more than 30 days.
3.3. Retention ZWICK will only retain your personal data for as long as it is necessary for the stated purpose (receiving pdf information requested through form or receiving occasional newsletters), taking into account also our need to answer queries or resolve problems, provide improved and new services, and comply with legal requirements under applicable laws. This means that we may retain your personal data for a reasonable period after your last interaction with us. When the personal data that we collect is no longer required in this way, we destroy or delete it in a secure manner.
4. Contact us ZWICK acts as \"data controller\" for the personal data it processes in the framework of this Privacy Notice. If you have any questions or comments regarding this Privacy Notice or ZWICK's personal data collection practices, please contact us via e-mail support@zwick.it or in writing to ZWICK SRL, Zona Produttiva 25, I-39028 Silandro (BZ). We will respond to your inquiry in no longer than 30 days."

"Last updated: June 2019
- Acceptance of Terms: Welcome to ZWICKbox Smart Locker owned and operated by ZWICK. ZWICK provides tools and technology to make it easier than ever to send and receive packages on your schedule. ZWICK uses website, mobile application, a connected parcel locker, software, processes and services to allow users to accept and send packages (collectively the \"Services\").
By using the Services, you agree to comply with and be legally bound by these Terms & Conditions (\"Terms\"), whether or not you become a registered user of the Services. These Terms govern your access to and use of the Services and constitute a binding legal agreement between you and ZWICK. In these Terms, \"you\", \"your\" and \"User\" refer to the individual or entity that uses the Services. \"We\", \"us\", or \"our\" refer to ZWICK. If you are entering into these Terms on behalf of a company or other legal entity, you represent that you have the authority to bind such entity, its Users, its Administrators, and its affiliates to these Terms.
Please read carefully these Terms and our Privacy Policy (which are incorporated herein and may found at www.ZWICK.it).
You acknowledge and agree that, by accessing or using the services, you are indicating that you have read, and that you understand and agree to be bound by these terms, whether or not you have registered. If you do not agree to these terms, then you should not register as a user and you have no right to access or use the services.
- Modification: ZWICK reserves the right to modify or discontinue, temporarily or permanently, any aspect of the Services at any time and without prior notice. ZWICK may also modify these Terms at any time. By continuing to access or use the Services after we have posted a modification or have provided you with notice of a modification of these Terms, you are indicating that you agree to be bound by the modified Terms. If the modified Terms are not acceptable to you, your only recourse is to cancel your account and stop using the Services.
- Eligibility; Digital Signature: The Services are intended solely for persons who are 18 or older who are fully able and competent to enter into the terms, conditions, obligations, affirmations, representations, and warranties set forth in these Terms, and to abide by and comply with these Terms.
By registering for a free User Account, or by clicking to accept these Terms, you are deemed to have executed these Terms electronically, effective on the date you register your Account. Your creating of a User account constitutes an acknowledgement that you are able to electronically receive, download, and print these Terms, and any amendments.
- How the Services Work:
The Services consist of tools, technology and services available via a platform by which Users with a current and valid User Account can accept and send packages.
To access and use the Services, you must register an account (\"User Account\") and become a User. You agree to provide accurate, current and complete information during registration and to update such information to keep it accurate, current and complete. You agree that you will safeguard your password and that you are solely responsible for any activities or actions under your User-Account, whether or not you have authorized such activities or actions. You will immediately notify us of any unauthorized use of your User Account. ZWICK assumes no responsibility for User Account information.
To use the Services, you also must be registered with a ZWICKbox Smart Locker. You will receive push notification via the ZWICK app regarding when any package is delivered to your Locker or picked-up from your Locker for delivery. If you experience any technical or other difficulty in retrieving your package from your box, please contact us at support@zwick.it.
ZWICK's role is solely to facilitate the availability of the Services, including Lockers, and to provide support related thereto. ZWICK is not a courier and is not involved in the transportation of packages.
- User Representations and Warranties: By submitting the User registration form, you represent, warrant and agree to the following:
o You are at least 18 years of age, are authorized to create a User Account, and have full power and authorization to enter into these Terms.
o You accept and agree that we have no responsibility or liability for the storage or transmission of packages, and that all aspects of package shipping and delivery remains controlled in all respects by the relationship between you, any delivery service which uses your Locker, and any company sending packages to you. Your Locker is in your control and you are responsible for your packages as if you engaged personally with the delivery service.
- Ownership: All trademarks, service marks, logos, trade names and any other proprietary designations of ZWICK used herein are trademarks or registered trademarks of ZWICK. Any other trademarks, service marks, logos, trade names and any other proprietary designations are the trademarks or registered trademarks of their respective parties.
- License to Services and ZWICK Content: Subject to your compliance with these Terms, ZWICK grants you a limited, non-exclusive, revocable, non-transferable license to access and view any ZWICK Content to which you are permitted access, solely for your personal purposes.
You will not use, copy, adapt, modify, prepare derivative works based upon, distribute, license, sell, transfer, publicly display, publicly perform, transmit, broadcast or otherwise exploit the Services or ZWICK Content, except as expressly permitted in these Terms. No licenses or rights are granted to you by implication or otherwise under any intellectual property rights owned or controlled by ZWICK or its licensors, except for the licenses and rights expressly granted in these Terms.
- Termination and User Account Deactivation: These Terms will continue in full effect unless and until your account or these Terms are terminated as described herein. You have the right to deactivate your account at any time by using the account deactivation interface provided in the ZWICK app. Only Owners have the ability to deactivate and delete team accounts. All accrued rights to payment and rights granted to ZWICK, as well as the terms below, shall survive termination of these Terms.
- Disclaimers: If you choose to use the services, you do so at your sole risk. The services and content are provided \"as is\", without warranty of any kind, either express or implied. Without limiting the foregoing, ZWICK explicitly disclaims any warranties of merchantability, fitness for a particular purpose, quiet enjoyment or non-infringement, and any warranties arising out of course of dealing or usage of trade. ZWICK makes no warranty that the website, application, services, or content will meet your requirements or be available on an uninterrupted, secure, or error-free basis. We further disclaim any guarantee that the boxes or items deposited in them will not be subject to theft, fire, water damage, inclement weather, vandalims or loss or damage generally.
You are solely responsible for all packages sent or received by you until a delivery service takes legal possession according to the terms and conditions of that delivery service. At no time is ZWICK in possession of or in any way responsible for any package, including when it is contained within your box. You acknowledge and agree to indemnify and hold ZWICK harmless in connection with any claim and any damages or expenses arising from your use of the services.
- Limitation of Liability You acknowledge and agree that, to the maximum extent permitted by law, the entire risk arising out of your access to and use of the services remains with you. Neither ZWICK nor any other party involved in creating, producing or delivering the services or content will be liable for any incidental, special, exemplary or consequential damages, including lost profits, loss of data or loss of goodwill, service interruption, computer damage or system failure or the cost of substitute products or services, or for any damages for personal or bodily injury or emotional distress arising our of or in connection with these terms, or from the use of or inability to use the services or content, whether based on warranty, contract, tort (including negligence), product liability or any other legal theory, and whether or not ZWICK has been informed of the possibility of such damage, even if a limited remedy set forth herein is found to have failed of its essential purpose.
- Indemnification: You agree to release, defend, indemnify, and hold ZWICK and its affiliates and subsidiaries, and their officers, directors, employees and agents, harmless from and against any claims, liabilities, damages, losses, and expenses, including, without limitation, reasonable legal fees, arising out of or in any way connected with (a) your access to or use of the Services; (b) your violation of these Terms; (c) your User Content; (c) your reliance on any information exchanged via the Services; (d) your violation of any third party right, including without limitation any copyright, property, or privacy right; or (e) any claim that you or your User Content caused damage to a third party. ZWICK shall have the right to control all defense and settlement activities.
- Assignment: You may not assign or transfer these Terms, by operation of law or otherwise, without ZWICK's prior written consent. Any attempt by you to assign or transfer these Terms, without such consent, will be null and of no effect. ZWICK may assign or transfer these Terms, at its sole discretion, without restriction. Subject to the foregoing, these Terms will bind and inure to the benefit of the parties, their successors and permitted assigns.
- Notices: Unless otherwise specified herein, any notices or other communications permitted or required hereunder, including those regarding modifications to these Terms, will be in writing and given by ZWICK (i) via e-mail to the e-mail address on your account or (ii) by posting to the website or via the application. For notices made by e-mail, the date of receipt will be deemed the date on which such notice is transmitted. You may provide notice to us by e-mail at support@zwick.it
- Applicable Law and Place of Jurisdiction: The courts of ZWICK's registered office and principal place of business shall have exclusive jurisdiction and venue. However, ZWICK is also free to appeal to the court of competent jurisdiction at the registered office and principal place of business or domicile of the customer. All legal relations between the customer and ZWICK shall be subject to the substantive law. The Vienna Convention on the International Sale of Goods shall not apply."
"What would you like to do today?"
"Please select locker you would like to use"

"Thank you! Your request was submitted.
We’ll notify you once your access has been granted."

"With our app you can easily collect parcels delivered to you at any convenient time.
You need to make sure you have a stable internet connection, bluetooth turned on and are in a proximity of the locker.
If all above mentioned prerequisites are met you can proceed with parcel pickup.
Scenario one: Lock icon is grey = you are not meeting above mentioned prerequisites. Please check if your internet connection is stable, bluetooth is enabled and you are in proximity of the locker.
Scenario two: Lock icon is red = you are meeting all the prerequisites and are ready to pickup your parcel. Just press the red lock icon and locker will open immediately.
Scenario three: Lock icon is green = your locker doors opened, you picked up your parcel. In this step you need to close the door and push “CONFIRM” button within the App."

"With our app you can easily send parcels using single or multiple parcel lockers that you own / have access to.
You need to make sure you have a stable internet connection, bluetooth turned on and are in a proximity of the locker.
In the first step you need to choose size of your parcel (MPL users only).
Secondly, you enter last four digits of tracking number granted by your service provider. Those four numbers make your PIN which will later on be used by courier to pickup your parcel.
Final step includes placing package in the open locker, closing the door and pushing “FINISH” button within the App.
"

"With our app you can share access to your locker to a trusted person - third parties authorised to use your locker.
You can choose from the list of available users (predefined group) for a one-tap action of granting/removing access.
Another option is manual entry where you are required to fill in name, e-mail address (can also be selected from contacts) and define access details. You can choose to “Grant full access” with sharing permissions (meaning that your trusted person has an option to share access to other trusted persons) or “Parcel pickup only”.
Trusted person also needs to be an App user. If they are not, they should be prompted to install the App in order to use this service."
"Nobody from your group members has access to this locker. Press the + icon to add a new member to your access sharing group."
"You are currently not a member of anyone's access sharing group."
"There are no lockers (MPL or SPL) that could be shared. You need to be owner of SPL or in some group of MPL."
"Group name can not start with empty space."
"We have generated a new PIN for your delivery:"

"Please do not forget to send this PIN to the recipient of this parcel. If the packet should be picked up by the Swiss Post please make \"Pick at Home\" process directly with Post service and write this PIN in the pick-up explanation text."

"Last updated: February 2020

Smart Locker Technologies provides tools and technology to make it easier than ever to send and receive packages on your schedule. Smart Locker Technologies uses website, mobile application, a connected parcel locker, software, processes and services to allow users to accept and send packages (collectively the \"Services\").
By using the Services, you agree to comply with and be legally bound by these Terms & Conditions (\"Terms\"), whether or not you become a registered user of the Services. The Services are not intended for children under 13; if you are under 13 years of age, then please do not use the Service.
By registering for a free User Account, or by clicking to accept these Terms, you are deemed to have executed these Terms electronically, effective on the date you register your Account. Your creating of a User account constitutes an acknowledgement that you are able to electronically receive, download, and print these Terms, and any amendments.
How the Services Work The Services consist of tools, technology and services available via a platform by which Users with a current and valid User Account can accept and send packages.
To access and use the Services, you must register an account (\"User Account\") and become a User. You agree to provide accurate, current and complete information during registration and to update such information to keep it accurate, current and complete. You agree that you will safeguard your password and that you are solely responsible for any activities or actions under your User Account, whether or not you have authorized such activities or actions. To use the Services, you also must be registered with Smart Locker Technologies. You will receive push notification via the Flexilocker app regarding when any package is delivered to your Locker or picked-up from your Locker for delivery. If you experience any technical or other difficulty in retrieving your package from your box, please contact us at info@smartlockertec.com.
Smart Locker Technologies' role is solely to facilitate the availability of the Services, including Lockers, and to provide support related thereto. Smart Locker Technologies is not a courier and is not involved in the transportation of packages.
User Representations and Warranties By submitting the User registration form, you represent, warrant and agree to the following:

Smart Locker Technologies may assign or transfer these Terms, at its sole discretion, without restriction. Subject to the foregoing, these Terms will bind and inure to the benefit of the parties, their successors and permitted assigns.
Notices Unless otherwise specified herein, any notices or other communications permitted or required hereunder, including those regarding modifications to these Terms, will be in writing and given by Smart Locker Technologies via e-mail to the e-mail address on your account or (ii) by posting to the website or via the application. "Last updated: February 2020
Smart Locker Technologies AG, as well as any affiliated or related company (collectively, \"Smart Locker Technologies\", \"we\", \"us\" or \"our\"), recognizes the importance of your privacy. This privacy policy tells you what personal information we collect and how we use it. Smart Locker Technologies may change this privacy policy from time to time, in its sole discretion, and any such changes will become effective when we post the revised privacy policy online.
By using any Smart Locker Technologies equipment, website or application, or visiting any Smart Locker Technologies website or application product, software, data, content, and/or service (collectively, the \"Services\"), you are declaring that you understand and agree to the terms of this policy.
1. What Information Do We Collect? a. Personally-Identifiable Information: We may collect personally identifiable information when you specifically and knowingly provide it to us, for example when you access the Services and provide User Content (as defined in the Flexilocker Terms of Service), or when you contact us with your name, address, or E-mail address. Smart Locker Technologies does not consider personal Information to include information that has been anonymized so that it does not allow a third party to easily identify a specific individual. We collect and use personally-identifiable information to operate and improve our Services, to allow you to provide third parties or other Users access to your User Content, to provide customer service, to communicate with you when requested, and to perform research and analysis aimed at improving our products, services and technologies.
You may always choose not to provide personal information, but if you so choose, the Services will not be available to you. Note that personally identifiable information we collect and your User Content may be stored and processed outside of your country.
b. Non-Personally-Identifiable Information: We may collect and aggregate non-personally identifiable information, such hardware types, geographic location, and access times and durations.
c. Website Use and Technologies: When you use the Services, Smart Locker Technologies, or third parties on our behalf, may collect non-personally identifiable information via the use of pixels, programs, cookies and other similar technologies. Cookies, for example, are pieces of information that are transferred to an individual's hard drive for record-keeping purposes. They are used to assist you in using site information and content by saving your user preferences which allows us to identify registered users and save you time by eliminating the need to repeatedly enter the same information. They are also used to collect aggregate information about users on an anonymous basis. In addition to cookies, we may use other technologies, including single-pixel gifs (also known as web beacons) on our websites and in promotional e-mail messages or newsletters. These electronic images assist us in determining how many users have visited certain pages or opened messages or newsletters. We do not use these single-pixel gifs to collect personal information. You have the ability to accept or decline cookies.
Most browsers automatically accept cookies, but you can modify your browser setting to decline cookies or to request your permission each time a service attempts to set a cookie. Please be aware that the site is optimally designed to operate with cookies enabled in your internet browser. If you choose to decline cookies, you may not be able to sign in or use other interactive features of the Services that depend on cookies.
2. What Do We Do With The Information That We Collect? Except as disclosed in this privacy policy, Smart Locker Technologies does not share your personal information with any outside parties.
a. Smart Locker Technologies will use the personally identifiable information directly submitted by you and your User Content solely for the purpose for which you have provided it, such as providing a third-party access to your User Content, or request information from us. We may share this as your agent and attorney-in-fact with the third-parties which you have selected to perform services on your behalf, or service providers who perform services on our behalf such as providing data storage, data transmission, etc. Those companies will be permitted to obtain only the personal information they need to provide the Services, will be required to maintain the confidentiality of the information, and will be prohibited from using it for any other purpose. Also, if we go through a corporate sale, merger, reorganization, dissolution or similar event, data we gather from you may be part of the assets transferred or shared in connection with due diligence for any such transaction. Any acquirer or successor company may continue to use the data we collect from you as described in this notice.
b. Smart Locker Technologies, third-parties you authorize, or our third-party partners may use non-personally-identifiable information to track and analyze usage and volume statistical information from our users to administer content and to provide the Services. We may also perform statistical analysis of user behavior in order to measure interest in our online products and services for product development purposes.
c. Disclosure: As a general rule, Smart Locker Technologies will not disclose any of your personally identifiable information or your User Content except under one of the following circumstances: we have your permission or it is legally required. Smart Locker Technologies may share the non-personally identifiable information that Smart Locker Technologies gathers, in aggregate form only, with advertisers and other partners.
3. How Does A User Change Or Update Information? If you have any questions or concerns about this privacy policy or would like the personally identifiable information that you have provided to be removed from our files, please contact Smart Locker Technologies via e-mail at info@smartlockertec.com
4. Security and Encryption We follow generally accepted industry standards to help protect your personal information. No method of transmission over the internet, mobile technology, or method of electronic storage, is completely secure. Therefore, while we endeavor to maintain physical, electronic, and procedural safeguards to protect the confidentiality of the information that we collect online, we cannot guarantee its absolute security.
5. Changes to This Policy We reserve the right to change the terms of this privacy policy at any time. When we make changes, we will revise the \"last updated\" date at the top of the policy. If there are material changes to this statement or in how we will use your personal information, we will notify you by prominently posting a notice of such changes here or on our home page, or by sending you an e-mail. We encourage you to review this policy whenever you visit one of our sites."

"We are committed to protecting your privacy and take the security of our clients information very seriously.
Cookies Policy. Information and Use of Cookies. What are Cookies? Cookies are small amounts of information which some websites store on your computer to make it easier for you to log on to and use them during future visits. In reality, a cookie is a small text file which is stored by the user’s browser and contains data, not code, so it can’t contain a virus or spyware. This doesn’t mean that all cookies are harmless in intent, but they can only ever store information.
How we use your information
We ‘analytical’ cookies on this site to allow us to monitor website traffic and analyse how visitors use it via Google Analytics. This service tracks information about how visitors interact with the site, including the number of visitors to our website, where visitors have come to the website from and the pages they visit. We use this information to help us improve our website.
Such information will not identify you personally it is statistical data about our visitors and their use of our website. This statistical data is completely anonymous and does not identify any personal details whatsoever.
All computers have the ability to decline cookies. You can configure your web browser to refuse cookies, or to be informed if a cookie is set. You can find out how to do this by clicking help on your browser menu. By using our website, you agree that we can place these types of cookies on your device."

"Vertrag / Nutzungsvereinbarung / Bedingungen für SmartBoxBasel
1. Vertrag / Geltungsbereich
Die Huber AG, Betreiberin und Inhaberin der SmartBoxBasel ist eine rechtlich als Aktiengesellschaft statuierte juristische Person des schweizerischen Obligationenrechts. Kunden resp. Nutzer (nachstehend Kunde genannt) im Sinne dieser Vereinbarung sind natürliche Personen, welche individuell für sich und/oder als Mitarbeitende eines Unternehmens für dieses die Dienstleistung der SmartBoxBasel benutzen und/oder verwenden. Inhalt dieser Vereinbarung ist die Regelung der Rechte und Pflichten betreffend Nutzung der SmartBoxBasel.
Mit der Annahme (online / übereinstimmende Willensäusserung) der Allgemeinen Geschäftsbedingungen für die SmartBoxBasel schliesst der Kunde einen Vertrag für die Nutzung der vorliegenden Dienstleistung ab. Spätestens mit der Nutzung des Dienstes durch den Kunden gelten der Vertrag sowie die Anwendung der Allgemeinen Geschäftsbedingungen (nachfolgend AGB genannt) für die SmartBoxBasel als abgeschlossen und angenommen.
1.2 Geltungsbereich und Vertragsbestandteile Diese AGB regeln die Nutzungsmöglichkeiten der SmartBoxBasel-Dienstleistungen der Huber AG und / oder ihrer Drittpartner (nachfolgend Partner genannt) durch den Kunden.
2. Rechte und Pflichten
Die Huber AG verpflichtet sich ihre Leistungen entsprechend dem Stand der Technik zu erfüllen oder erfüllen zu lassen. Sie ist dazu berechtigt, qualifizierte Dritte resp. Partner beizuziehen; zieht sie Dritte bei, so wählt sie diese sorgfältig aus, instruiert und überwacht diese.
Die Huber AG bietet keinerlei Gewähr für andere Kunden, Gesellschaften oder Dritte.
Der Kunde garantiert die Richtigkeit seiner persönlichen Daten (Name, Adresse usw.) bei der Registrierung für die SmartBoxBasel-Dienste.
Die Huber AG ist berechtigt, vom Nutzer die Personendaten (Namen, Vornamen, Telefonnummern und E-mail-Adressen), Logindaten sowie die für die Nutzung bei SmartBoxBasel weiteren Daten (namentlich UserID, IP-Addresse etc.) notwendig sind zu speichern und auszuwerten.
Die Huber AG ist berechtigt auf Nachweis auf ein berechtigtes Interesse oder bei Verdacht auf Missbrauch oder bei Hinweisen bezüglich unsachgemässer oder vertragswidriger Nutzung der SmartBoxBasel entsprechende Informationen zum Kunden an Dritte weiterzugeben.
Die Huber AG kann den Zugriff auf die SmartBoxBasel einschränken oder aufheben, wenn dies aus Gründen der Sicherheit, der Serverintegrität oder für technische Massnahmen erforderlich ist.
Wer sich mit seinem Login bei der SmartBoxBasel authentisiert hat, gilt gegenüber der Huber AG als entsprechend legitimiert. Dies gilt auch dann, wenn es sich bei der betreffenden Person nicht um den tatsächlich berechtigten Nutzer handeln sollte.
3. SmartBoxBasel-Standorte und zugehörige AGB
3.1 Standort-Verzeichnis
Das aktuelle Standortverzeichnis aller SmartBoxBasel -Standorte ist im Internet unter smartboxbasel.ch verfügbar.
4. SmartBoxBasel-Dienst
4.1 Benutzerhandbuch
Das SmartBoxBasel-Benutzerhandbuch ist im Internet unter guide.smartboxbasel.ch verfügbar und bildet einen integralen Bestandteil der Vereinbarung mit Huber AG und Partner.
4.2 Registrierung
Um die SmartBoxBasel-Dienste nutzen zu können, ist es erforderlich, sich unter www.smartboxbasel.ch oder über die SmartBoxBasel User App zu registrieren. Während der Registrierung erhält der Kunde einen Bestätigungslink per E-Mail, der bestätigt werden muss, um die Registrierung abzuschließen.
Die Nutzung dieses Dienstes als alternative Lieferadresse erfordert eine Registrierung und eine E-Mail-Adresse. Jede Nutzung der Dienste muss einer natürlichen Person zugeordnet werden können.
Durch die Registrierung erteilt der Kunde allen Kurier-, Express- und Paketdienstleistern eine generelle Abstellgenehmigung, um Pakete ohne Empfangsbestätigung an die SmartBoxBasel-Standorte zu liefern. Die Abstellgenehmigung gilt für alle angebotene Services von den jeweiligen Dienstleistern.
4.3 Auswählen eines Standorts
Der Kunde hat jederzeit die Möglichkeit, seinen SmartBoxBasel-Standort frei zu wählen. Für die Zustellung ist die SmartBoxBasel-Adresse auf der Sendung relevant.
4.4 Adressierung
Jede Sendung, die über einen SmartBoxBasel-Standort zugestellt werden soll, muss wie im spezifischen Standortverzeichnis angegeben und wie folgt adressiert sein:
Name Vorname SmartBoxBasel – “6-Stelliger Code“ Strasse Nr, PLZ Stadt
Der “6-Stellige Code“ wird bei der Registrierung automatisch vom System generiert und darf bei der Angabe der Lieferadresse nicht fehlen. Die Strasse Nr, PLZ Stadt bezieht sich auf den spezifischen Standort der SmartBoxBasel.
4.5 Definition einer SmartBoxBasel-Sendung
Sofern für einen bestimmten SmartBoxBasel-Standort nicht anders definiert, können Pakete bis zu 30 kg, mit einer von einem Lieferdienst offiziell generierten Sendungsnummer, an eine SmartBoxBasel adressiert und von dort abgeholt werden.
4.6 Abholung einer Sendung
Für jede abzuholende Sendung wird der Kunde per E-Mail und/oder Push-Benachrichtigung auf seiner Smartphone App benachrichtigt. Mit dem darin enthaltenen Abholcode (Abholpin oder QR-Code) und/oder über die SmartBoxBasel-Benutzeranwendung kann die Sendung innerhalb der in der Email angegebenen Frist (Standard sind 72 Stunden) aus der spezifischen SmartBoxBasel freigegeben werden. Es liegt in der Verantwortung des Kunden, sicherzustellen, dass der erhaltene Abholcode nicht für unerwünschte Dritte zugänglich ist.
Im Falle nicht verfügbarer Schließfachgrößen oder Störungen am Terminal wird die Sendung nicht zugestellt. Eine Lieferung an den gewünschten SmartBoxBasel-Standort kann nicht garantiert werden.
Im Falle der Nichtabholung der Sendung innerhalb der angegebenen Frist wird dem Kunden eine E-Mail-Nachricht zugestellt. Der Zugang zu dem spezifischen Schließfach wird dann dem Administrator gewährt, der die Sendung herausholt und lagert. Der Administrator setzt sich folglich mit dem Kunden in Verbindung. Es wird entweder eine Abholung am Lagerungsort oder eine persönliche Heimlieferung durch den Administrator organisiert. Sollte sich der Empfänger nach 5 Werktagen ab Lagerung nicht zurückmelden, wird der Auftraggeber der Sendung durch den Administrator kontaktiert. Der Auftraggeber entscheidet folglich über das weitere Vorgehen der Sendung.
4.7. Versenden einer Sendung
Für jede Sendung generiert die SmartBoxBasel einen PIN. Die Rücksendung muss beim jeweiligen Paketdienstleister online vom Kunden gemeldet werden. Nach der Abholung der Sendung durch den Paketdienstleister erhält der Kunde auf seiner Smartphone App eine E-Mail und/oder Push-Benachrichtigung mit der Abholungsbestätigung.
5. Haftung
Das Unternehmen haftet höchstens bis zu einem Betrag von CHF 500pro Haftungsfall. Diese Haftungsbeschränkung gilt für jegliche Haftung des Unternehmens unter allen Titeln, soweit eine Haftungsbeschränkung rechtlich zulässig ist und sofern die Haftung gemäss nachfolgenden Ausführungen nicht gänzlich ausgeschlossen ist.
Huber AG und Partner haften nicht für Schäden, die durch falsche Angaben des Kunden entstehen. Die Huber AG und Partner übernehmen insbesondere keine Haftung für unzustellbare SMS, Push-Notizen oder E-Mails infolge einer falschen Mobiltelefonnummer oder E-Mail-Adresse. Kunden werden über unzustellbare Benachrichtigungen nicht informiert. Die Huber AG und Partner übernehmen keine Haftung für die an einen Anbieter zur Weiterleitung gesandten SMS, Push-Notizen und/oder E-Mails, wenn diese dem Kunden vom Anbieter nicht zugestellt werden konnten. Die Huber AG übernimmt keine Haftung für die vom Partner erbrachten Dienstleistungen. Die Huber AG haftet insbesondere nicht für höhere Gewalt, Folgeschäden und entgangenen Gewinn. Sendungen, welche Flüssigkeiten und temperaturempfindliche Waren enthalten, dürfen nicht an Paketboxen bestellt und adressiert werden. Die Huber AG übernimmt keine Haftung für solche Sendungen.
Wenn Sie sich für die Nutzung der Dienste entscheiden, tun Sie dies auf Ihr eigenes Risiko. Die Huber AG übernimmt keine Gewähr dafür, dass die Website, Anwendungen, Dienste oder Inhalte Ihren Anforderungen entsprechen oder ununterbrochen, sicher oder fehlerfrei zur Verfügung stehen. Wir lehnen ferner jede Garantie ab, dass die in den Boxen deponierten Gegenstände uneingeschränkt geschützt sind vor Diebstahl, Feuer, Wasser, Witterung, Vandalismus, Verlust oder Beschädigung.
Sie sind allein verantwortlich für alle Pakete, die von Ihnen versandt oder empfangen werden, bis ein Lieferdienst gemäss den Geschäftsbedingungen dieses Lieferdienstes in den Rechtsbesitz gelangt. Zu keinem Zeitpunkt ist die Huber AG im Besitz oder in irgendeiner Weise verantwortlich für ein Paket, auch wenn es in Ihrer Box enthalten ist. Sie erkennen an und erklären sich damit einverstanden, die Huber AG im Zusammenhang mit jeglichen Ansprüchen und Schäden oder Kosten, die sich aus ihrer Nutzung der Dienste ergeben, schadlos zu halten.
Im Übrigen schliesst die Huber AG jegliche gesetzlich mögliche und zulässige Haftung für sich und Dritte vollumfänglich aus. Der Kunde haftet persönlich für die von ihm verursachten Schäden gegenüber anderen Personen, Kunden oder der Huber AG.
6. Datenschutz
Die Huber AG sowie die Kunden verpflichten sich, alle ihnen im Rahmen dieser Vereinbarung übergebenen und bekanntwerdenden Informationen – auch über ein allfälliges Vertragsende hinaus – nach den Massgaben des geltenden Datenschutzgesetzes zu bearbeiten. Sie verpflichten sich ausserdem, die gesetzlich vorgeschriebenen organisatorischen und technischen Massnahmen zur Wahrung des Datenschutzes zu treffen und dafür zu sorgen, dass alle Mitarbeitende und beigezogene Dritte, welche Zugang zu solchen Daten erhalten, in geeigneter und nachprüfbarer Weise über die Pflichten zur Wahrung des Datenschutzes unterrichtet werden.
Der Kunde nimmt ausdrücklich zur Kenntnis und ist damit einverstanden, dass die Zugangsdaten (insbesondere Username, Name, Vorname, Telefonnummern, Email) gespeichert und von der Huber AG bearbeitet werden.
7. Beendigung / Sperre des Zuganges
Sofern für einen bestimmten SmartBoxBasel-Standort nicht anders definiert, hat die Huber AG die Möglichkeit, die SmartBoxBasel-Dienste für den Kunden innerhalb von 30 Tagen zum Monatsende per Mail zu stornieren.
Die Huber AG ist zudem berechtigt, bei Gesetzesverstössen, Missbrauch oder Verletzung von Rechten Dritter jederzeit, nicht aber verpflichtet, den Zugang des Nutzers ohne jegliche Entschädigungspflicht sofort zu sperren. Wird der Zugang gesperrt, so teilt sie das dem Kunden unverzüglich mit. Damit ist der Vertrag mit dem Kunden per sofort beendet.
8. Änderungen des Vertrages / der Bedingungen
Die Huber AG kann den vorliegenden Vertrag sowie diese Bedingungen jederzeit revidieren. Die Revisionen werden dem Kunden schriftlich oder in einer anderen geeigneten Form mitgeteilt. Die Änderungen gelten als akzeptiert, wenn der Kunde die Dienstleistung trotz dieser Änderungen weiterhin nutzt oder wenn er nicht innerhalb eines Monats schriftlich widerspricht.
9. Anwendbares Recht und Gerichtsstand
Die Rechtsbeziehungen zwischen dem Kunden, der die SmartBoxBasel nutzt, und Huber AG sowie deren Partner unterliegen ausschliesslich dem Schweizer Recht. Der Gerichtsstand ist Basel.
10. Kontakt
Die Kontaktperson für eine bestimmte SmartBoxBasel finden Sie im Internet unter smartboxbasel.ch, indem Sie auf den Link Kontakt für die jeweilige CPL-Stelle klicken."

"General Terms and Conditions for Flexilocker CPL
1. Area of validity and description of service
1.1 Acceptance of the General Terms and Conditions for Flexilocker CPL The General Terms and Conditions for Flexilocker CPL (hereinafter “GTC”) shall be deemed as accepted no later than with the use of the service by the Customer.
1.2 Scope of application and contract components These GTC regulate the options for use of the Flexilocker CPL services provided by Smart Locker Technologies AG (hereinafter referred to as SLT) and / or its third party partners (hereinafter referred to as Partner) by the customers (hereinafter referred to as the Customer) for a specific Flexilocker CPL point.
2. Flexilocker CPL points and related GTC
2.1 Location directory The current location directory of all Flexilocker CPL points is available on the Internet at link1_gen.
3. Flexilocker CPL Service
3.1 User Manual The Flexilocker CPL user manual is available on the Internet at link2_gen and forms an integral component of the agreement with SLT and Partner.
3.2 Registration In order to be able to use the Flexilocker CPL services, it is necessary to register at link3_gen or via the Flexilocker CPL User App. During the registration, the Customer will receive an email confirmation link which needs to be confirmed in order to finish registration.
The use of this service as an alternative delivery address requires registration and an email address. Every use of the services must be able to be assigned to a natural person. By registering, the customer grants all courier, express and parcel service providers a general permit to deliver parcels to the Flexilocker locations without confirmation of receipt. The permit applies to all services offered by the respective service providers.
3.3 Selecting a location The Customer has the option of freely selecting his Flexilocker CPL point at any time. The Flexilocker CPL address on the consignment is relevant for the delivery.
3.4 Addressing Any item to be delivered to a Flexilocker CPL point needs to be as specified in the directory and addressed as follows:
Name/First name CPL-6-digits code Street, number, zip code, town
The \\"6-digit code\\" is automatically generated by the system during registration and needs to be included when entering the delivery address. The street, number, zip code, city refers to the specific location of the Flexilocker-CPL.
3.5 Definition of a Flexilocker CPL consignment Packages up to 30 kg, with a tracking number officially generated by a delivery service, can be addressed to and collected from a Flexilocker CPL, unless otherwise defined.
3.6 Collecting a consignment For each consignment to be collected, the Customer is notified by e-mail and/or push notification. With the collection code contained in this and/or via the Flexilocker CPL User App, the consignment can be released from the specific Flexilocker CPL within the specified time limit (default is 72 hours). It is the responsibility of the Customer to ensure that the collection code received is not accessible to unwanted third parties.
In the event of unavailable locker sizes or faults on the terminal, the consignment will not be delivered. A delivery to the requested Flexilocker CPL location cannot be guaranteed.
An email message will be sent to the Customer in case of non-collection of the consignment within the specified time limit. Access to the specific locker will then be provided to Partner who will collect and store the consignment.
4. Guarantee The Customer guarantees the correctness of his personal details (name, address etc.) with the registration for the Flexilocker CPL services.
5. Liability SLT and Partners are not liable for damage resulting from incorrect details from the Customer. SLT and Partner in particular accepts no liability for undeliverable SMS messages, push-notifications or e-mails as a result of an incorrect mobile phone number or e-mail address. Customers are not informed about undeliverable notifications. SLT and Partner assumes no liability for the SMS messages, push-notifications and/or e-mails sent to a provider for forwarding if it could not be delivered to the Customer by the provider. SLT accepts no liability for the services provided by Partner. SLT is, in particular, not liable for force majeure, consequential damage and lost earnings.
6. Information to third parties SLT and Partner can provide third parties with the Customer’s name and domicile address, provided said party can prove a legitimate interest therein.
7. Cancellation Unless otherwise defined for a specific Flexilocker CPL point, SLT has the option of cancelling the Flexilocker CPL services for the Customer in writing within 30 days to the month-end. SLT is authorized to block the selected service at any time with immediate effect, if it is suspected that the range of services have been misused.
8 Amendments to the Terms and Conditions SLT can revise these Terms and Conditions at any time. The revisions will be communicated to the Customer in writing or in another appropriate form. Changes will be deemed to have been accepted if the Customer uses the service despite these changes or if he does not object in writing within one month.
9. Applicable law and place of jurisdiction The legal relationships between the Customer using the Flexilocker CPL and SLT and Partner are exclusively governed by Swiss law. The place of jurisdiction is Berne.
10. Contact The contact for a specific CPL point is available on the Internet at link4_gen by clicking the Contact link for the specific CPL point."
"Password must be at least 6 characters long and contain no spaces. It must have at least one digit, one lower case letter, one uppercase letter and one special character (@#$%^&+=\-_!)."
"Please rate the quality of our service."
"Email and password don't match, or your account has been disabled."
"No deliveries to CPL are possible until you enter your verification pin!"
"Please enter your verification PIN from a letter we have sent to your home address."
"You still haven't received a letter with verification PIN?"
"In a few days you should receive a verification PIN in a letter that was sent to the address you've provided. Also you should confirm link in your email ( %s )"
"48 hours or 2 days have not yet passed since your registration request. Please try again later!"
"Last date and time of sending verification pin: %s"
"Expired deliveries will be collected by the appropriate collector company and you’ll be informed of the next steps."
"You need to select locker to be able to copy address."
"Wrong phone format. It needs to have at least 8 numbers and maximum 20 numbers."
"In 1-2 workdays you should get a letter with verification code by post."
"You will have to enter this verification code inside the App."
"You will be able to use all of the app’s features once you enter validation code from the letter and your mailing address becomes validated."
"You will be able to use all of the app’s features once you confirm you link inside e-mail address."
"An e-mail with verification link will be sent to your e-mail address. You’ll have to open that link to verify your e-mail address."
"Generated pick@home key will be deleted and deactivated and locker will open again."
"You have to be in proximity of the locker to cancel pick@home key."
"Need help? Call us or send an e-mail"
"You are not in proximity of locker."
"You currently don't have access for this locker."
"No deliveries to locker are possible until you enter your verification pin!"
"First you need to request access for this locker."
"Please wait, while admin approve your access, for this locker."
"Please put the QR code in front of the Locker scanner at the 10-15cm distance for pick up operation or enter your pick up pin: %s"
"Please put the QR code in front of the Locker scanner at the 10-15cm distance for pick up operation."
"To cancel Pick@home, please collect your parcel using PIN %s"
